data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: You detect multiple ships running at maximum power nearby, but you can't see anything through this thick nebula.
Get closer.
Ignore them.
You distance yourself from the ships, just in case.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You find a Slug Cruiser and Rock ship at a standoff, both with weapons armed and ready to fight. You could intervene before this gets out of hand.
Hail them to see what's wrong.

The Slug captain explains that they upgraded the Rock ship's reactor and now the 'thick boulder heads' are refusing to pay for the work done. The Rock Captain says the 'gelatinous ooze rats' did a poor job that is not worth their agreed upon price.
Offer to pay off the Rock debt.
You pay off the debt. The Rock Captain still seems annoyed at the Slug's getting their 'undeserved' scrap, but at least the situation will remain peaceful.
Continue...
Demand the Rock ship pay the agreed upon price.
(Rock Crew) Talk the Rock into peacefully paying the full price.
With much grumbling, the Rock Captain agrees to pay the price.
Continue...
Demand the Slug ship give a full refund.
(Slug Crew) Talk the Slugs into peacefully accepting the new price.
With much grumbling, the Slug Captain agrees to give a full refund.
Continue...
(Mind Control) Mind Control the Slugs into giving a full refund.

You calibrate the Mind Control to lock onto the Slug ship... but nothing happens. It's at this moment you remember Slugs can't be mind controlled at all. The Slug captain laughs at your pitiful attempt and you leave in shame.
You have better things to attend to, leave them.
Leave them be.
You leave the two ships to their bickering.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: Apparently the Rock Captain was more annoyed than you thought, they shut off all communication and turn on you, the 'slime balls' defender.
Continue...
With much grumbling, the Rock Captain agrees to pay the price.
Continue...

A massive explosion emanates from the Rock Ship, shattering its hull and sending debris on an unavoidable collision course to your ship. Seems like that reactor upgrade was poorly done after all, and the Slugs took the opportunity to jump away.
The Slugs offer their thanks for your help, and jump away. Their true appreciation is questionable, but at least you can get back to your mission.
The Slug Captain offers a free reactor upgrade for your help. It never hurts to get a little power boost!
The Slug Captain, thankful for your help, offers a reactor upgrade for your ship... for a 'fair' price.
Agree to the price.
You let their team on board and after a short time they finish their work.
Decline the offer.
You break communications and prepare to move on.
"Hahahah! Like hell I'd take the adviccce of a Federation captain, essspecccially when he tellss me I should just let myssself get ssscammed out of my money!" The Slug ship immediately turns hostile!
Continue...
You're pretty certain you hear the Slugs say some nasty things about your mother under their breath, but they do reluctantly accept the Rockman's new price.
Continue...

A massive explosion emanates from the Rock Ship, shattering its hull and sending debris on an unavoidable collision course to your ship. Seems like that reactor upgrade was poorly done after all, and the Slugs took the opportunity to jump away.
The Rock captain grumbles then jumps away without another word. You know Rockmen tend to be ungrateful as a culture, but this is just plain rude.
The Rock captain seems rather ungrateful for your assistance, and still bent out of shape by his unsatisfactory reactor upgrades. "And what am I supposed to do about this crapjob upgrade?"
Fix it for them. [-25~]

With some scrap of your own, you work on the Rockman's reactor to spruce it up. "Still a cruddy job, but at least you aren't as bad as those sludge gushers." It's a very reluctant compliment, but you can tell the Rockman appreciates it because he returns carrying a gift!
Deal with it.

You aren't sure what reaction you expected from this response, but the abrupt laughter from the Rock captain surprises you. "I like your style." Brief, but a compliment from a Rockman is nothing to scoff at. Especially since it's followed by a small gift as a "thank you" for helping them.

This beacon seems to serve as a meeting place for local traffic. It seems you can find crew willing to fight on your ship here... for a price.

data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: You come across an asteroid mining colony. They message you immediately, saying, "Greetings. Our supplies of mining explosives have run out ever since the Rebels blockaded this system. Do you have any extra explosives?"
Give them the requested 5 missiles.
Give them 15 missiles.
(Explosive Replicator) Use the replicator to synthesize the missiles for them.
(Missile Weapon) Offer to blast through the mine with your Launcher.

"I don't think you quite understand. I understand your... enthusiasm... but it's not exactly 'union friendly' to use military ballistic weapons in mining operations. Perhaps it's best we don't make any trades..."
(Bomb Weapon) Offer to solve their problem by using a controlled explosion from your bomb. [-1}]
"Curious. I did not consider the practicality of using a bomb for such matters. I suppose it should be safe enough. You have my permission."
Continue...
(Lost Sun Commando) Offer to teach them how to construct makeshift explosives.

Your commando, being both an experienced arsonist and knowledgeable in the ways of explosives, explains to the miners how the Lost Suns have been using "recycled" ammunition to save costs. Thoroughly impressed by this knowledge, the colony's leader grants you access to some of their latest spoils.

"Wow. This will help our efforts considerably." They offer to have their engineers fix up your ship and upgrade your reactor.

data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/textList[: What at first seems to be a simple nebula is actually filled with a good amount of debris from a brutal exchange between several ships. Wreckage drifts by your screens and tumbles into the depths of the nebula to be lost to sight. It's hard to determine who the combatants were without closer investigation.

You have jumped into the aftermath of what seems to have been a brutal exchange between several ships. Wreckage drifts by your screens, and you can still see the remains of the dying ships sparking and breaking apart. It's hard to determine who the combatants were without closer investigation.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: You scan the battlefield, and with the aid of your Sensors, you are able to salvage a good amount of material from the wreckage. Well-stocked, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield and find a prototype military vessel in the debris! The crew has been killed, but their working prototype weapon array is still intact! You salvage it and bring it aboard.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.
You scan the battlefield, and find little remains. Disappointed, you prepare to jump.

You scan the battlefield, and are able to salvage some useful material from the wreckage.
As you approach the wreckage, a Mantis ship screams into the system... either sensing prey - or to finish the job its fellows started.
Continue...

The wreckage appears to be a battle between Federation fighters and Rebel cruisers. Though outnumbered, it looks like the Federation fought valiantly. As you begin a more detailed scan of the wreckage, Rebel reinforcements arrive in the system and target your ship!
Continue...
As you approach the wreckage, a Zoltan ship makes its arrival. It immediately mistakes you for one of the attackers, declares you as hostile aggressors in violation of Zoltan space, and opens fire!
Continue...
As you approach the wreckage, a Coalition vessel nearby activates! It seems the ship was aptly positioned inside the field of wreckage to spy on Federation ships like yours!
Continue...

As you approach the wreckage, a Slug ship makes its arrival. It hesitates for a moment, as if surprised to see anyone remaining, and then jumps away without a word. You resume scanning the system, wary of any other visitors.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/textList[: You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team C12 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team F17 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team A50-3 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team Z9 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team T6 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team R11 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
You receive a hail from a station orbiting a nearby planet. "Captain, we are Federation Terraforming Team W8-2 and are in need of assistance. Do you have some time?"
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: You offer your assistance.

"Thank you! We need to scan this planet for life before we can begin terraforming, but our sensors can't get the necessary power to scan through this atmosphere. We've got a schedule to keep, any chance you can help?"
Attempt to scan the planet.
(Advanced Sensors) Set sensors to maximum and scan.
(Zoltan Crew) Send your crewman to overcharge their systems.
(Slug Crew) Check if your Slug senses any presence.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Scan the planet.
(Lifeform Scanners) Scan the planet.
You do not have time.
"We understand. Best of luck on your mission, sir!"
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: It seems your sensors are no more powerful than the terraformer's. You apologize and continue on your way.
You find if you modulate the feedback signal of your sensors to just the right frequency, you're able to get through the atmosphere and perform a complete scan!
Continue...

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as thanks.

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your reactor as thanks.

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks, it's a pirate!
Continue...

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks - seems like it was a Duskbringer fugitive!
Continue...
A complete scan of the planet reveals a simple mold as the only life present. The terraformers claim their terraforming plans are only hindered by intelligent life; they can begin their work.
Tell them to stop. Any life is valuable.
"But our livelihood depends on this job! Who cares about some silly mold? We'll pay you to look the other way!"
Accept the bribe and leave.
Offer to pay them to at least delay until the mold can be studied.
They see reason and accept the offer. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as an apology for their behaviour.
Power your weapons and demand they leave at once.
They shut off communications, but you can tell they have begun an evacuation procedure.
Leave them to their work.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: As soon as you jump into the system, you receive a hail from a nearby civilian Engi vessel. Their Captain appears on your screen: "Strange bug. Can you assist in debugging?"
Listen to their problem.
(Anti-Virus) Offer to use your anti-virus.
"Federation vessel has made fatal logic error. Virus is not present. Bug refers to: insectoid. Problem-solving skills of squishy organics preferred to stringent Harmony protocols."
Listen to their problem.
Explain that you can't do any programming and leave.
The Engi try to convince you that you don't understand, but you insist and cease communications.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
"Found malfunctioning Free Mantis. Believes it is human. Will receive input only from human or fellow Free Mantis. Danger Evaluation: Extremely High. Provide assistance."
Send a shuttle with an away team to help.
Leave them, a cornered Mantis is too dangerous.
(Human Crew) Send your human crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.
The Mantis is grateful to see 'another human', and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
Return him home.
(Free Mantis Crew) Send your Mantis crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.
The sight of a Free Mantis calms down the cornered insectoid, who introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
Return him home.
(Hive Crew) Send your Mantis crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.
The Mantis is terrified at the sight of your crewmember. He lashes out, instantly killing your crew and turning on the Engi. You have no choice but to leave.
Fortunately, dismemberment is one of the many cases your Clone Bay readily covers. That doesn't make it hurt any less, but your crew are probably used to it by now.
(Suzerain Crew) Your Suzerain is a natural leader of the Mantis. Send it in.

The Engi are visibly uncomfortable in the presence of your Suzerain. It enters the room where the Mantis is kept, and in a matter of minutes has slit its throat. When it returns, it explains: "It one of brainless Free Mantis types. Only solution was kill." The Engi seem satisfied and pay you for your "efforts".
(Mind Control) Use your Mind control System to calm him down.

The Mantis calms down and communicates thanks to the Engi and yourself for helping. He requests to be dropped off at a nearby planet, at the human colony where he was raised. They are grateful for his return and offer a reward.

The colony is a mining operation that specializes in FTL fuel. Robert's family, the head engineers, are excited to see him, and are very grateful for his return. Apparently he ran away to 'join the Federation' like his older brother, but was never accepted onto a ship.
Offer him a position on your ship.
He graciously accepts, having always wanted to serve in the Federation.
Ask if they can take a look at your engines.
They are happy to take a look, and are able to offer some suggestions for improvements.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: After an hour of convincing, the Mantis finally calms down and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
Continue...
The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. One of your crew is eviscerated before the rest are able to stop him. The Engi apologize for your loss.
Your crew's clone is waiting when you return to the ship.

The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. You're able to subdue him and leave him at a Mantis colony in a neighboring system. They don't seem pleased or grateful at his return.

(Targeting Jammer) Disable their Weapon system before docking.
You receive a hail as soon as your jamming takes effect: "What have you done!? You can never trust a Federation ship! Here, take your 'standard toll'. I really should do business elsewhere, scum."
A human in an exquisite suit meets you on board. "Welcome to my ship! We specialize in drones of all kinds, can I interest you in any?"
Buy some Drone parts.

"Ah, I'm sorry to hear that! Pleasant journeys." Once back to the helm, a series of explosions rocks your ship. The pirate ship has powered its weapons! You receive a message, "You shouldn't waste people's time Captain!"
Continue...
Your sensors have picked up a refugee ship drifting through the system, no doubt one of many fleeing the Rebel advance. It doesn't appear to have detected you... or else it is trying to avoid notice.

data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/textList[: You find a small space station that appears to abandoned.
You arrive to find what appears to be a colonized moon, however scans show it has been abandoned. You also detect an abandoned space station near the Beacon.
This area shows signs of a battle some time ago. There are scattered remains of ships but one station appears to be intact.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: As you approach it becomes clear that the station is simply an empty shell. It has been stripped of useful materials long ago.
You approach cautiously but you detect no danger. It appears to have been a small rest stop that was abandoned a while ago. You take what few supplies you can find.
Upon closer inspection it appears to have a large portion of its hull destroyed. You take what few supplies you can find.
The station is in disarray. You find a cloning bay partially intact but nothing else seems to be functioning.
(Clone Bay) Search for a surviving DNA bank.
While the cloning facilities are no longer functioning, you find someone was in queue to be cloned. You transfer their data to your Clone Bay, and after some time their body is rebuilt.
Continue...
Scrap the machinery.
You take what you can and prepare to move on.
You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile scanners pick up a previously undetected pirate ship moving in to attack!
Continue...

You dock with the station to take a look inside. However no sooner do you open the airlock than pirates burst in. Meanwhile multiple warning signals go off on the bridge. The pirates have activated a remote planetary defense system and it's locking onto your ship!
The clone is extremely confused but calms down after you try to explain the situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone is extremely confused but seems to accept their new situation. With no other options the clone offers to work on your ship for a time.
The clone emerges in a crazed frenzy and refuses to calm down. You have no choice but to fight.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/textList[: It looks like this Beacon is home to a Rebel checkpoint. They're stopping and searching any ship that passes through. Civilians are being harassed, and Federation members are detained. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.
Another Rebel checkpoint is monitoring this location. A number of civilian ships are awaiting inspection, any of them could be Federation loyalists. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.

A Rebel space station and single fighter is monitoring this Beacon for Federation activity. A number of civilian ships are docked, awaiting inspection by the Rebels and possible detainment if they are Federation loyalists. The Rebels haven't noticed you yet.
A rather large fleet of civilian ships are held up at this Beacon. It appears to be a Rebel checkpoint; everyone is being inspected for possible ties to the Federation. No one has noticed you yet.
These Rebels are easily swayed by the prospect of additional scrap. They release the civilian ships and everyone is free to go.
Like most Rebels, these are just men trying to get by in a rough galaxy. They take your scrap and let everyone continue their journeys.
As everyone currently awaiting inspection is human anyway, the Rebels let them go. They take your scrap and tell you to hurry along.
They eagerly accept your bribe, obviously revolutionaries are under paid. The civilian ships all begin to jump away.
Fly behind a moon and stay hidden.
Shut down all non-vital systems and stay hidden.
Stay quiet and hope they don't notice you.
Stay out of their way and charge your FTL drive.
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: Fend for yourself, attack and escape.
You move in to attack the Rebel ship.
Continue...
Bribe the Rebels to release the civilian ships.
Contact the civilian ships.
(Forged ID) Pretend to be a Rebel ship.

Rebel forces are bloated with washups, conscripts, or disheartened officers who are only in its ranks because their reality was conquered by Rebels first. The Rebel running the checkpoint barely even glances at your ID before deciding to let you past.
Take a chance and request they free some civilians.

At first the Rebels don't buy it, but you manage to pull some trickery to convince them that several of the civilians were cleared for release. The officer in charge is satisfied with this at first while you start taking civilians on-board, but eventually grows impatient and decides he's had enough of your ruse.
Continue...
Take this chance to do something aboard the ship.
(Engineer Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship.

Rebel forces are bloated with washups, conscripts, or disheartened officers who are only in its ranks because their reality was conquered by Rebels first. The Rebel running the checkpoint barely even glances at your Engineer's outdated Rebel ID before deciding to let you past.
Take a chance and request they free some civilians.

At first the Rebels don't buy it, but you manage to pull some trickery to convince them that several of the civilians were cleared for release. The officer in charge is satisfied with this at first while you start taking civilians on-board, but eventually grows impatient and decides he's had enough of your ruse.
Continue...

data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/eventList: The civilians are grateful. However, none of them seem eager to be mistaken as Federation loyalists so they quickly jump away.
Some of the civilians pool together their excess scrap to try to repay you for your help.
One of the civilian ships quietly teleports over a crate of Federation military supplies.
One of the civilian ships contacts you and reveals they are Federation loyalists. An eavesdropping Rebel swoops in, destroys the ship, and turns to attack you!
Continue...
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/textList[: You stumble across a Rebel ship distributing supplies to local civilian colonies. It's probably not anything military grade, but every little bit helps...
You find a Rebel combat ship that has been reassigned as an emergency supply vessel. The local civilians are apparently in need of help, and the Rebels are rising to the occasion.
The Rebels in this system are doing supply runs for the local space stations. These civilians have likely been out of supply for months due to the war and are in desperate need.
Civilian colonists loyal to the Rebel cause are present on a nearby planet. It looks like they are currently receiving a supply shipment. Could be useful.

Because of the war, thousands of colonists have had their supply lines disrupted and have found themselves in dire straits. It seems in this system, the Rebels are sympathetic and are distributing what little supplies they can spare.
You make to preparations to leave. One of the civilian leaders contacts you: "That Rebel was our sole source of supplies. You have doomed us all."
You leave the civilians with the supplies, though without the Rebel that was running supplies to them its unlikely they'll live long.
You wonder if any more Rebels will be available to help these civilians on the edge of nowhere. Oh well, for you a few more dead Rebels matter more than the lives of a thousand colonists.

Before your FTL drive charges, you receive a hail: "My son was on that ship. He only helped the Rebels because they cared enough to help us. Without him to find us supplies, we'll likely be forgotten and die out here."
data/newEvents.xml.append$/FTL/event[@na: Attack the Rebels.
You engage the Rebel ship.
Continue...
(Forged ID) Pretend to be a Rebel ship and deliver the supplies yourself.
